alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 14 at 4:51AM AKST until December 14 at 11:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM AKST THIS EVENING FOR THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Visibility as low as one quarter mile or less at times. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...Until 11 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 45 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Moderate to heavy snow will continue through early this morning. Snow intensity will lighten up this afternoon for a period of time before the intensity increases again this evening.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
